intro: Eutrema penlandii, commonly known as Penland's sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, where it thrives in salty and windy conditions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, round, black seeds. Eutrema penlandii is an important component of coastal ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various insects and birds.
